borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <div>The bulk, mass, size, siting and design of the proposed development is considered to be disproportionately large compared to the original house, almost doubling the depth of the dwelling.&nbsp; This proposal combined with existing developments on the plot are considered to constitute to the overdevelopment of the application site. Both of the above would be harmful to the appearance of the house, built form of the terrace and character of the area. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:&nbsp;The National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC, 2021), Policy D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policy CP3 of the Local LDF Core Strategy (2010), policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide DPD (2011), The Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (2012), and policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The LBBD Draft Local Plan (2021).</div>

<div>The bulk, mass, size, siting and design of the proposed development due to the excessive depth, would be significantly overbearing and result in harmful overshadowing/a loss of daylight to neighbouring property no.45 Kier Hardie Road.&nbsp; As such it is believed to constitute an unneighbourly development and contrary to:&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">The National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC, 2021), Policy D4 of the London Plan (2021), policies CP2 and CP3 of the Local LDF Core Strategy (2010), policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide DPD (2011), The Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (2012), and policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and DMD6 </span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">of The</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">&nbsp;LBBD Draft Local Plan (2021).</span></div>
description: Construction of a single storey rear extension.
